no_offense_factors: If she travels with a group; if she travels where it is safe and free from danger; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Outside her own country: in any country apart from the one where she is living

rule_pali: Cārikā: Yā pana bhikkhunī cārikaṃ pakkameyya... pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 39. Staying During Rains: Should any bhikkhunī go on a journey during the Winter/Summer (outside Rains) without reason... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she goes on seven-day business; if she goes because something is disturbing her; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Upassaya: Yā pana bhikkhunī upassayaṃ paribhuñjitvā cārikaṃ pakkamantī... na paṭinissajjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 40. Supervision: Should any bhikkhunī stay apart from a supervising bhikkhunī... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there is an obstacle; if she searches for a companion nun, but is unable to find one; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Rājāgāra: Yā pana bhikkhunī rājāgāraṃ vā cittāgāraṃ vā ārāmaṃ vā uyyānaṃ vā pokkharaṇiṃ vā dassanāya gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 41. Royal Pleasure House: Should any bhikkhunī go to see a royal pleasure house or picture gallery... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she sees it while remaining in a monastery; if she sees it while coming or going; if she goes when there is something to be done and then sees it; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Āsandi: Yā pana bhikkhunī āsandiyā vā pallaṅke vā nisīdeyya vā nipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 42. Sofa: Should any bhikkhunī sit on a sofa (divan)... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she uses a high couch after cutting off the legs; if she uses a luxurious couch after removing the decorations with images of predatory animals; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Suttakantana: Yā pana bhikkhunī suttaṃ kanteyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 43. Spinning Yarn: Should any bhikkhunī spin yarn... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she spins yarn that has already been spun; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Gihiveyyāvacca: Yā pana bhikkhunī gihiveyyāvaccaṃ kareyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 44. Household Work: Should any bhikkhunī do household work (cooking/serving) for laypeople... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If it is a congee drink; if it is a meal for the Sangha; if it is to venerate a shrine; if she cooks congee, a meal, or fresh food for her own service-provider, or she washes a wrap garment or a turban for them; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Adhikaraṇa: Yā pana bhikkhunī aññissā bhikkhuniyā... adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasametvā... puna kopheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 45. Dispute Resolution: Should any bhikkhunī agree to settle a dispute and then not do it... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there is an obstacle; if she searches, but is unable to find anyone to settle it; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: A legal issue: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business To resolve a legal issue: to make a decision on a legal issue

rule_pali: Gihidāna: Yā pana bhikkhunī agārikassa vā paribbājakassa vā... khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 46. Giving Food (Household): Should any bhikkhunī give food to a householder/wanderer with her own hand... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she does not give, but has it given; if she gives by placing it near the person; if she gives ointments for external use; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Fresh food: apart from the five cooked foods and water and tooth cleaners, the rest is called “fresh food”. Cooked food: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat

rule_pali: Āvasathacīvara: Yā pana bhikkhunī āvasathacīvaraṃ na paṭinissajjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 47. Menstruation Cloth: Should any bhikkhunī use a menstruation cloth without washing it (or giving it to be washed)... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she relinquishes it and then uses it; if she uses it again at the next turn; if there are no other menstruating nuns; if her robe has been stolen; if her robe has been lost; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: A communal robe: it is given specifically for the use of menstruating nuns. Does not relinquish, but continues to use it: if she uses it for two or three days, washes it on the fourth day, and then uses it again without relinquishing it to a nun or a trainee nun or a novice nun, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Āvasatha: Yā pana bhikkhunī āvasathaṃ... na paṭinissajjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 48. Dwelling: Should any bhikkhunī set aside a dwelling and not use it... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she relinquishes it and then goes; if there is an obstacle; if she searches, but is unable to find anyone to relinquish it to; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Tiracchānavijjā: Yā pana bhikkhunī tiracchānavijjaṃ pariyāpuṇeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 49. Learning Worldly Arts: Should any bhikkhunī learn worldly arts (fortune telling, spells)... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she learns writing; if she learns protective verses; if she learns verses for the purpose of protection; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
offense_factors_bmc: Worldly subjects: whatever is external to the Buddha’s Teaching, not connected with the goal
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Tiracchānavijjāvācana: Yā pana bhikkhunī tiracchānavijjaṃ vāceyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 50. Teaching Worldly Arts: Should any bhikkhunī teach worldly arts... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she teaches writing; if she teaches protective verses; if she teaches verses for the purpose of protection; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
offense_factors_bmc: Worldly subjects: whatever is external to the Buddha’s Teaching, not connected with the goal
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Ārāmapavesana: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṃ sabhikkhukaṃ ārāmaṃ anāpucchā paviseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 51. Entering Monastery: Should any bhikkhunī enter a monastery (bhikkhu's park) without asking permission... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she enters after asking permission of an available monk; if, when there is no available monk, she enters without asking permission; if she goes while looking at the head of a nun in front of her; if she is going to where the nuns have gathered; if a path goes through the monastery; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: There are monks in a monastery: even where monks stay at the foot of a tree. Enters it without asking permission: if she crosses the boundary of an enclosed monastery without asking permission of a monk or a novice monk or a monastery worker, she commits an offense entailing confession. If she enters the vicinity of an unenclosed monastery, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Akkosana: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuṃ akkoseyya vā paribhāseyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 52. Reviling: Should any bhikkhunī revile or abuse a monk... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she is aiming at something beneficial; if she is aiming at giving a teaching; if she is aiming at giving an instruction; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: If she abuses or reviles someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct

rule_pali: Caṇḍīkatā: Yā pana bhikkhunī caṇḍīkatā gaṇassa paribhāsikā, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 53. Gossip: Should any bhikkhunī, having a hot temper, gossip about a group... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she is aiming at something beneficial; if she is aiming at giving a teaching; if she is aiming at giving an instruction; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: The community: the Sangha of nuns is what is meant

rule_pali: Nimantitā: Yā pana bhikkhunī nimantitā vā pavāritā vā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 54. Eating Before Confession: Should any bhikkhunī eat invited food before confessing an offense... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she has refused an offer to eat more, but not an invitation; if she drinks congee; if she eats more after getting permission from the person who invited her; if, when there is a reason, she uses post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: staple or non-staple food that is not leftover. 2) Effort: One eats the food after having eaten and turned down an offer of further food
notes: A donor could feel insulted if bhikkhus refused further offers of food, finished their meal, and then went to eat someplace else. It is also designed to protect bhikkhus from being forced to go hungry by stingy or impoverished donors
formulas: What is left over should be made left over, saying, ‘All this is enough
useful_texts: BU-PC33, 36; Cv 6 10.1 Famine times Mv 6 18.4, 6 9.2, 6 20.4, resinded Mv 6 32.2

rule_pali: Maccharī: Yā pana bhikkhunī kulamaccharinī, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 55. Stinginess: Should any bhikkhunī serve a group but be stingy with the food... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: Keeps for herself: if she thinks, “What can I do so that other nuns don’t come?” and she then speaks disparagingly about that family to the nuns, she commits an offense entailing confession. If she speaks disparagingly about that family to the nuns, she commits an offense entailing confession
notes: If she is not keeping a family to herself, but describes the drawbacks as they are; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Abhikkhuka: Yā pana bhikkhunī abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṃ vaseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 56. Wrong Time (Preceptor): Should any bhikkhunī spend the Rains Retreat in a dwelling where there is no Preceptor... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If the monks who entered the rainy-season residence there depart or disrobe or die or join another group; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: A monastery without monks: she is not able to go to the instruction or to a formal meeting of the community. If she thinks, “I’ll stay here for the rainy-season residence,” and she prepares a dwelling, sets out water for drinking and water for washing, and sweeps the yard, she commits an offense of wrong conduct. At dawn, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Pavāraṇā: Yā pana bhikkhunī vassaṃ vutthā ubhatosaṅghe tisso vācāyo na pavāreyya diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 57. Pavarana: Should any bhikkhunī not invite the Community (Pavarana) at the end of the Rains... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there is an obstacle; if she searches, but does not find anyone to invite for correction; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Who has completed the rainy-season residence: who has completed the first three or the last three months of the rainy-season residence. If she thinks, “I won’t invite correction from both Sanghas in regard to three things—what has been seen, heard, or suspected,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Ovāda: Yā pana bhikkhunī ovādāya vā saṃvāsāya vā na gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 58. Ovada (Advice): Should any bhikkhunī not go for the Ovadā (instruction) or the Uposatha... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there is an obstacle; if she searches for a companion nun, but does not find one; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: The instruction: the eight important principles. The community: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training. If she thinks, “I won’t go to the instruction or to formal meetings of the community,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Uposathapucchana: Anvaddhamāsaṃ bhikkhuniyā bhikkhusaṅghato dve dhammā paccāsiṃsitabbā: uposathapucchakañca ovādūpasaṅkamanañca. Taṃ atikkāmentiyā pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 59. Asking for Ovada: Should any bhikkhunī not ask the date of the Uposatha or the teaching... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there is an obstacle; if she searches for a companion nun, but does not find one; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Every half-month: every observance day. The observance day: there are two observance days: the fourteenth and the fifteenth day of the lunar half-month. The instruction: the eight important principles. If she thinks, “I won’t enquire about the observance day, nor ask for the instruction,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Pasākhā: Yā pana bhikkhunī pasākhe jātaṃ gaṇḍaṃ vā rūhiṃ vā anapaloketvā saṅghaṃ vā gaṇaṃ vā... bhedāpeyya vā... pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 60. Creating a Sore: Should any bhikkhunī burst a boil or scab without permission... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gets permission and then has it ruptured, split open, washed, anointed, bandaged, or unwrapped; if she has a female companion who understands; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: The lower part of the body: below the navel and above the knees

rule_pali: Gabbhinī: Yā pana bhikkhunī gabbhiniṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 61. Pregnant Ordination: Should any bhikkhunī ordain a pregnant woman... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives the full admission to a woman who is pregnant, but she does not perceive her as such; if she gives the full admission to a woman who is not pregnant, and she does not perceive her as such; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Pāyantī: Yā pana bhikkhunī pāyantiṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 62. Nursing Ordination: Should any bhikkhunī ordain a woman giving suck (nursing)... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives the full admission to a woman who is breastfeeding, but she does not perceive her as such; if she gives the full admission to a woman who is not breastfeeding, and she does not perceive her as such; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Sikkhamānā: Yā pana bhikkhunī dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 63. Two Years Training: Should any bhikkhunī ordain a probationer (Sikkhamana) who has not trained for two years in the six rules... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives the full admission to a trainee nun who has trained in the six rules for two years; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: That trainee nun should then be told to say this: ‘I undertake to abstain from killing living beings for two years without transgression. I undertake to abstain from stealing for two years without transgression. I undertake to abstain from sexual activity for two years without transgression. I undertake to abstain from lying for two years without transgression. I undertake to abstain from alcohol, which causes heedlessness, for two years without transgression. I undertake to abstain from eating at the wrong time for two years without transgression. Who has not trained: the training has not been given to her, or the training has been given to her, but she has failed in it
formulas: Venerables, I, so-and-so, am a trainee nun under Venerable so-and-so. I ask the Sangha for approval to train for two years in the six rules.’ And she should ask a second and a third time. A competent and capable nun should then inform the Sangha: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. So-and-so, who is a trainee nun under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years. If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval to trainee nun so-and-so to train in the six rules for two years. This is the motion. Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. So-and-so, who is a trainee nun under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years. The Sangha gives approval to trainee nun so-and-so to train in the six rules for two years. Any nun who approves of giving approval to trainee nun so-and-so to train in the six rules for two years should remain silent. Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up. The Sangha has given approval to trainee nun so-and-so to train in the six rules for two years. The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus

rule_pali: Dutiya-sikkhamānā: Yā pana bhikkhunī dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ sikkhamānaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 64. Without Agreement: Should any bhikkhunī ordain a probationer who has trained but has not been agreed upon by the Community... it is to be confessed.
formulas: Who has not been approved: approval to be fully admitted has not been given though a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement. Venerables, I, the trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, ask the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted.’ And she should ask a second and a third time. A competent and capable nun should then inform the Sangha: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. This trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained under Venerable so-and-so for two years in the six rules, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted. If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval for the trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained for two years in the six rules, to be fully admitted. This is the motion. Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. This trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained under Venerable so-and-so for two years in the six rules, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted. The Sangha gives approval for the trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained for two years in the six rules, to be fully admitted. Any nun who approves of giving approval for the trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained for two years in the six rules, to be fully admitted should remain silent. Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up. The Sangha has given approval for the trainee nun so-and-so, who has trained for two years in the six rules, to be fully admitted. The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus

rule_pali: Gihigatā: Yā pana bhikkhunī ūnadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 65. Married Girl (12): Should any bhikkhunī ordain a married girl of twelve years (without training)... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives the full admission to a girl less than twelve years old, but she perceives her as more; if she gives the full admission to a girl more than twelve years old, and she perceives her as more; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Dutiya-gihigatā: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripruṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 66. Married Girl (Training): Should any bhikkhunī ordain a married girl of twelve years who has not trained for two years... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old and who has trained in the six rules for two years; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Who has not trained: the training has not been given to her, or the training has been given to her, but she has failed in it
formulas: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. The married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years. If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years. This is the motion. Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. The married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years. The Sangha gives approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years. Any nun who approves of giving approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years should remain silent. Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up. The Sangha has given approval to the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old, to train in the six rules for two years. The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’

english_name: Ordaining Trained Married Girls Without Approval
rule_pali: Tatiya-gihigatā: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripruṇṇadvādasavassaṃ gihigataṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 67. Married Girl (Agreement): Should any bhikkhunī ordain a married girl who has trained but is not agreed upon... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives the full admission to a married girl who is more than twelve years old and who has trained in the six rules for two years and who has been approved by the Sangha; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Monks, approval should be given for the full admission of a married girl who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules. Who has not been approved: approval to be fully admitted has not been given though a legal procedure consisting of one motion and one announcement
formulas: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. This married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted. If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval for the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted. This is the motion. Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. This married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted. The Sangha gives approval for the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted. Any nun who approves of giving approval for the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted should remain silent. Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up. The Sangha has given approval for the married girl so-and-so, who is more than twelve years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted. The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.’”

rule_pali: Sahajīvinī: Yā pana bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā dve vassāni nānubandheyya... pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 68. Giving Restrictions: Should any bhikkhunī ordain a co-resident and then make her wait/obstruct her... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there is an obstacle; if she searches for someone to guide her, but cannot find anyone; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Neither guides her: she does not herself guide her—through recitation, through questioning, through instruction, though teaching. Nor has her guided: she does not ask anyone else. If she thinks, “I’ll neither guide her nor have her guided for two years,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Pavattinī: Yā pana bhikkhunī vuṭṭhāpitā pavattiniṃ dve vassāni nānubandheyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 69. Not Following: Should any bhikkhunī, having been ordained, not follow her preceptor for two years... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If the preceptor is ignorant or shameless; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Does not follow: does not herself attend on her. If she thinks, “I won’t follow her for two years,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Apakaḍḍhana: Yā pana bhikkhunī sahajīviniṃ apakaḍḍheyya vā apakaḍḍhāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 70. Dismissing: Should any bhikkhunī engage a companion and then dismiss her without reason... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there is an obstacle; if she searches for a companion nun for her, but cannot find anyone; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Kumāribhūta: Yā pana bhikkhunī ūnavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 71. Under 20: Should any bhikkhunī ordain a maiden under twenty years of age... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives the full admission to a girl less than twenty years old, but she perceives her as more; if she gives the full admission to a girl more than twenty years old, and she perceives her as more; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: An unmarried girl: a novice nun is what is meant

rule_pali: Dutiya-kumāribhūta: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu asikkhitasikkhaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 72. Maiden Training: Should any bhikkhunī ordain a maiden of twenty years who has not trained for two years... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives the full admission to an unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old, and who has trained in the six rules for two years; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Monks, approval is required for an unmarried girl who is eighteen years old to train in the six rules for two years
formulas: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. This unmarried girl so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years. If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval to the unmarried girl so-and-so who is eighteen years old to train in the six rules for two years. This is the motion. Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. This unmarried girl so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and training under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to train in the six rules for two years. The Sangha gives approval to the unmarried girl so-and-so who is eighteen years old to train in the six rules for two years. Any nun who approves of giving approval to the unmarried girl so-and-so who is eighteen years old to train in the six rules for two years should remain silent. Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up. The Sangha has given approval to the unmarried girl so-and-so who is eighteen years old to train in the six rules for two years. The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus

english_name: Ordaining Trained Unmarried Girls Without Approval
rule_pali: Tatiya-kumāribhūta: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇavīsativassaṃ kumāribhūtaṃ dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhaṃ saṅghena asammataṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 73. Maiden Agreement: Should any bhikkhunī ordain a maiden who has trained but is not agreed upon... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives the full admission to an unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old, who has trained in the six rules for two years, and who has been approved by the Sangha; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Monks, approval is required for the full admission of an unmarried girl who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules
formulas: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. This unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted. If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval for the unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted. This is the motion. Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. This unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, is asking the Sangha for approval to be fully admitted. The Sangha gives approval for the unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted. Any nun who approves of giving approval for the unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted should remain silent. Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up. The Sangha has given approval for the unmarried girl so-and-so, who is more than twenty years old and who has trained for two years in the six rules under Venerable so-and-so, to be fully admitted. The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus

rule_pali: Ūnavassā: Yā pana bhikkhunī ūnadvādasavassā vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 74. Too Many: Should any bhikkhunī ordain two probationers in one year (limit is one per year per preceptor)... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If one who has twelve years of seniority gives the full admission; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

english_name: Twelve Years of Seniority Without Approval
rule_pali: Paripuṇṇadvādasavassā: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇadvādasavassā alakkhaṇā vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 75. Not Allowed: Should any bhikkhunī ordain someone when she has not been allowed (appointed) to do so... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she has twelve years of seniority, has been approved by the Sangha, and then gives the full admission; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Monks, approval is required for a nun who has twelve years of seniority to give the full admission Venerables, I, the nun so-and-so who has twelve years of seniority, ask the Sangha for approval to give the full admission.’ And she should ask a second and a third time. The Sangha should then decide whether that nun is competent and has a sense of conscience. If she is ignorant and shameless, approval should not be given. If she is ignorant but has a sense of conscience, approval should not be given. If she is competent but shameless, approval should not be given. If she is competent and has a sense of conscience, approval should be given
formulas: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. The nun so-and-so, who has twelve years of seniority, is asking the Sangha for approval to give the full admission. If the Sangha is ready, it should give approval to nun so-and-so, who has twelve years of seniority, to give the full admission. This is the motion. Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen. The nun so-and-so, who has twelve years of seniority, is asking the Sangha for approval to give the full admission. The Sangha gives approval to nun so-and-so, who has twelve years of seniority, to give the full admission. Any nun who approves of giving approval to nun so-and-so, who has twelve years of seniority, to give the full admission should remain silent. Any nun who doesn’t approve should speak up. The Sangha has given approval to nun so-and-so, who has twelve years of seniority, to give the full admission. The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus

rule_pali: Asammata: Yā pana bhikkhunī paripuṇṇadvādasavassā alakkhaṇā sammatāpi vuṭṭhāpeyya... pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 76. Sick Student: Should any bhikkhunī not attend to a sick student (after ordination)... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she criticizes one who regularly acts out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, or fear; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Sikkha: Yā pana bhikkhunī sikkhamānaṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā dve vassāni saṅghena asammataṃ... pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 77. Instruction: Should any bhikkhunī not give instruction to her student for two years... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there is an obstacle; if she searches for someone to give her the full ordination, but is unable to find anyone; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: If she thinks, “I’ll neither give her the full admission nor make any effort to have her fully admitted,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession

english_name: Not Ordaining Trainees After She Follows
rule_pali: Anuvasa: Yā pana bhikkhunī anuvassaṃ vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 78. Every Year: Should any bhikkhunī ordain a student every year (should be every other year)... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there is an obstacle; if she searches for someone to give her the full ordination, but is unable to find anyone; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: If she thinks, “I’ll neither give her the full admission nor make any effort to have her fully admitted,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Ekavassa: Yā pana bhikkhunī ekavassaṃ dve vuṭṭhāpeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 79. Double Ordination: Should any bhikkhunī ordain two students in one year... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives her the full admission without knowing what she is like; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Men: those who have reached twenty years of age. Boys: those who have not reached twenty years of age. Socializing: she socializes with improper bodily and verbal actions. Temperamental: angry is what is meant. Difficult to live with: she causes suffering to others, and grieves herself

rule_pali: Chattupāhana: Yā pana bhikkhunī chattupāhanaṃ dhāreyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 80. Umbrella/Sandals: Should any bhikkhunī use an umbrella and sandals (visible luxury)... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives her the full admission without knowing; if she gives her the full admission after permission has been given; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Parents: the biological parents is what is meant. Husband: he who possesses her. Who has not been given permission: who has not asked permission

rule_pali: Yāna: Yā pana bhikkhunī yānena yāyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 81. Vehicle: Should any bhikkhunī go in a vehicle... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives her the full admission while the gathering has not yet left; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: When a given consent has expired: when the gathering has left

rule_pali: Saṅghāṇi: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṅghāṇiṃ dhāreyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 82. Women's Ornaments: Should any bhikkhunī wear women's ornaments... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives full admission every other year; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Gandhavaṇṇaka: Yā pana bhikkhunī gandhavaṇṇakaṃ dhāreyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 83. Perfume/Paint: Should any bhikkhunī wear cosmetics or perfumes... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she gives the full admission to one woman every other year; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Vāsitaka: Yā pana bhikkhunī vāsitakena piṇṇākena nahāyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 84. Scented Powder: Should any bhikkhunī use scented powder/clay... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she is sick; if she uses them in a monastery or in the vicinity of a monastery; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Who is not sick: who is comfortable without a sunshade and sandals. Who is sick: who is not comfortable without a sunshade and sandals. A sunshade: there are three kinds of sunshades: the white sunshade, the reed sunshade, the leaf sunshade. They are bound at the rim and bound at the ribs. Uses: if she uses them even once, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Bhikkhunī-ummaddāpanā: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā ummaddāpeyya vā parimaddāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 85. Rubbing/Massage: Should any bhikkhunī have herself rubbed or massaged by a bhikkhunī... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Who is not sick: who is able to travel on foot. Who is sick: who is unable to travel on foot. A vehicle: a wagon, a carriage, a cart, a chariot, a palanquin, a litter. Travels: if she travels in a vehicle even once, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Sikkhamānā-ummaddāpanā: Yā pana bhikkhunī sikkhamānāya ummaddāpeyya vā parimaddāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 86. Rubbing (Probationer): Should any bhikkhunī have herself rubbed by a probationer... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she wears it because she is sick; if she wears a girdle; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: A hip ornament: whatever goes on the hip

rule_pali: Sāmaṇerī-ummaddāpanā: Yā pana bhikkhunī sāmaṇeriyā ummaddāpeyya vā parimaddāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 87. Rubbing (Novice): Should any bhikkhunī have herself rubbed by a novice... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she does it because she is sick; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
offense_factors_bmc: Jewellery: what goes on the head, what goes around the neck, what goes on the hands, what goes on the feet, what goes around the hips
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Gihinī-ummaddāpanā: Yā pana bhikkhunī gihiniyā ummaddāpeyya vā parimaddāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 88. Rubbing (Housewife): Should any bhikkhunī have herself rubbed by a laywoman... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she does it because she is sick; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Saṅkaccika: Yā pana bhikkhunī asaṅkaccikā gāmaṃ paviseyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 89. Sitting without Vest: Should any bhikkhunī sit before a monk without wearing her vest (bodice)... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she does it because she is sick; if she bathes with ordinary oilseed flour; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Applicable to Bhikkhu as dukkata offences

rule_pali: Cīvarasaṅkamanīya: Yā pana bhikkhunī cīvarasaṅkamanīyaṃ dhāreyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 90. Robe Limits: Should any bhikkhunī wear a robe that is too large/wrong size... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Lasuṇa: (See Rule 1).
rule_english: 91. Garlic (Redundant): (Often merged/omitted in lists as it duplicates Rule 1, but preserved in some enumerations as specific context).
no_offense_factors: If she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Nacca: Yā pana bhikkhunī naccaṃ vā gītaṃ vā...
rule_english: 92. Dancing (Redundant): (Specifics on teaching dancing).
no_offense_factors: If she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Jantāghāra: Yā pana bhikkhunī jantāghāre nahāyeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 93. Sauna: Should any bhikkhunī bathe in a sauna... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Nahāna: Yā pana bhikkhunī... nahāyeyya... pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 94. Bathing Frequency: Should any bhikkhunī bathe more frequently than every half-month... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she sits down on the seat after asking permission; if she is sick; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Sits down on a seat: even if she sits down on the ground, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Nisīdanapaṭiggaha: Yā pana bhikkhunī nisīdanaṃ kārāpayamānā... pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 95. Seat Size: Should any bhikkhunī make a seat-cloth of wrong dimensions... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If she asks after getting permission; if she gets permission, but not in regard to a specific subject, and she then asks about any subject; if she is insane; if she is the first offender
notes: Asks a question: if she gets permission to ask about the discourses, but she asks about the Monastic Law or philosophy, she commits an offense entailing confession. If she gets permission to ask about the Monastic Law, but she asks about the discourses or philosophy, she commits an offense entailing confession. If she gets permission to ask about philosophy, but she asks about the discourses or the Monastic Law, she commits an offense entailing confession

rule_pali: Cīvara: Yā pana bhikkhunī... cīvaraṃ... pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 96. Robe Material: Should any bhikkhunī use specific expensive materials for robes... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If her robe is stolen; if her robe is lost; if she is sick; if she is not mindful; if she does not know; if there is an emergency; if she is insane; if she is the first offender

rule_pali: Musāvāda: Sampajānamusāvāde pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 97. Lying: (Start of Common Rules) Should any bhikkhunī tell a conscious lie... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: Who misrepresents the truth unintentionally like speaking quickly and saying one thing while meaning another
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Intention: the aim to misrepresent the truth; and 2) Effort: the effort to make another individual know whatever one wants to communicate based on that aim
notes: Falsehoods conveyed not only by speech but also by writing or gesture or silence
formulas: Cv 4 14.30 Senior confesses : C: Ahaṁ āvuso sambahulā nānā-vatthukāyo dukkaṭāyo āpattiyo āpanno. Tā paṭidesemi. A: Passatha bhante? C: Āma āvuso, passāmi. A: Āyatiṁ bhante saṁvareyyātha. C: Sādhu suṭṭhu āvuso saṁvarissāmi

rule_pali: Omasavāda: Omasavāde pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 98. Insulting: Should any bhikkhunī speak abusively... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If he is “aiming at Dhamma, aiming at (the person’s) benefit, aiming at teaching, if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Effort: One insults a person directly to his face.. 2) Object: The person is a bhikkhu. 3) Intention: One's motive is to humiliate him
notes: Must be made directly to the listener. It may be phrased either as sarcastic praise or as out-and-out abuse. Indirect insults are wrong doing
formulas: S. “I, friend, having many times fallen into grave offences with different bases, these I confess J. Do you see, ven. sir? S. Yes, friend, I see J. In future, ven. sir, you should be restrained S. It is well indeed, friend. I shall be restrained

rule_pali: Pesuñña: Bhikkhupesuññe pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 99. Slandering: Should any bhikkhunī slander another... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If he is not making dear, if he is not desiring dissension, if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: Both Z's listener and X are bhikkhus; X has made remarks about Y that qualify as a direct insult under the preceding rule (or, if he didn't make them in Y's presence, remarks that would have qualified as a direct insult had he done so). 2) Effort: Z reports X's remarks to his listener verbally or by gesture (as in writing a letter), 3) Intent: with the intent of ingratiating himself with his listener, or of causing a rift between his listener and X
notes: Telling a bhikkhu about insulting remarks made by another bhikkhu—in hopes of winning favor or causing a rift
formulas: For other categories of offenses, change dukkaṭāyo to thullaccayāyo, nissaggiyāyo pācittiyāyo, pācittiyāyo, or dubbhāsitāyo,

rule_pali: Padasodhamma: Yo pana bhikkhu anupasampannena padaso dhammaṃ vāceyya, pācittiyaṃ.
rule_english: 100. Memorizing Together: Should any bhikkhunī recite text line-by-line with a layperson... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: In making (him) recite it together, in studying it together, if while speaking he drops a phrase usually familiar, if he drops it while expounding, if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Effort: One gets a student to recite Dhamma line-by-line with oneself 2) Object: The student is neither a bhikkhu nor a bhikkhunī
notes: There was apparently the feeling that to teach non-ordainees to become skilled reciters of the texts was not good for the relationship between bhikkhus and the unordained
formulas: Cv 4 14.30 If the bhikkhu making confession is junior to the one acknowledging him, (taking dukkaṭa as an example): Confessant: Ahaṁ bhante sambahulā nānā-vatthukāyo dukkaṭāyo āpattiyo āpanno. Tā paṭidesemi. Acknowledger: Passasi āvuso? C: Āma bhante, passāmi. A: Āyatiṁ āvuso saṁvareyyāsi. C: Sādhu suṭṭhu bhante saṁvarissāmi. (Three times.)

rule_pali: Sahaseyya: Yā pana bhikkhunī anupasampannāya uttaridirattatirattaṁ sahaseyyaṁ kappeyya, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 101. Sleeping with Unordained: Should any bhikkhunī lie down together (in the same dwelling) with an unordained woman for more than two or three consecutive nights, it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If he stays for two or three nights; if he stays for less than two or three nights; if having stayed for two nights, departing before dawn on the third night, he stays again; if it is fully covered (but) not fully closed round; if it is fully closed round (but) not fully covered; if it is partially uncovered, partially not closed round; if the monk sits down while one who is not ordained is lying down; if one who is not ordained sits down while the monk is lying down; or if both sit down; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object an unordained person. 2) Effort: (a) lying down, (b) together in the same dwelling with the unordained person, (c) for four nights running
notes: Original purpose was to avoid sleeping in the same place with an unordained person whenever possible. It would also be a wise policy to avoid sleeping out in a public park, and get up and meditate before dawn every day
formulas: J. “I, ven. sir, having many times fallen into grave offences with different bases, these I confess S. Do you see, friend? J. Yes, ven sir, I see S. In future, friend, you should be restrained J. It is well indeed, ven. sir. I shall be restrained

rule_pali: Dutiya-sahaseyya: Yā pana bhikkhunī purisena saddhiṁ sahaseyyaṁ kappeyya, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 102. Sleeping with a Man: Should any bhikkhunī lie down together (in the same dwelling) with a man, it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If it is fully covered (but) not fully closed round, if it is fully closed round (but) not fully covered, if it is partially uncovered, partially not closed round, if the monk sits down while the woman is lying down, if the woman sits down while the monk is lying down, or if both sit down; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object female human being 2) Effort: (a) lying down, (b) together in the same dwelling with the female human being (c) the instant he lies down in the same dwelling with her
notes: Any woman regardless of whether she is related to the bhikkhu. Even if another man is present in the dwelling. meant to protect bhikkhus and prevent suspicious situations of serious offense
formulas: For other categories of offenses, change dukkaṭāyo to thullaccayāyo, nissaggiyāyo pācittiyāyo, pācittiyāyo, or dubbhāsitāyo,

rule_pali: Dhammadesanā: Yā pana bhikkhunī purisassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṁ deseyya aññatra viññunā itthiviggahena, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 103. Teaching Dhamma: Should any bhikkhunī teach more than five or six sentences of Dhamma to a man, unless a knowledgeable woman is present, it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If a learned man (be present); if he teaches dhamma in five or six sentences; if he teaches dhamma in less than five or six sentences; if he teaches having risen, having sat down again; if the woman having risen sits down again, and he teaches at that (moment); if he is teaching a different woman; if she asks a question; if (she) having asked a question, he speaks; if talking for the good of another, a woman hears; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object a female human being who knows what is and is not lewd, what is well-spoken and ill-spoken, and who has not asked one a question about the Dhamma. 2) Effort: One teaches her more than six sentences of Dhamma without a knowledgeable man present — i.e., a male human being who also knows what is and is not lewd, what is well-spoken and ill-spoken
notes: Aimed at preventing a bhikkhu from using his knowledge of Dhamma as a way of making himself attractive to a woman. As any man who teaches Dhamma soon learns, there are women who find such knowledge irresistible. Prevent dangers male teachers female students
formulas: Cv 4 14.30 Senior confesses : C: Ahaṁ āvuso sambahulā nānā-vatthukāyo dukkaṭāyo āpattiyo āpanno. Tā paṭidesemi. A: Passatha bhante? C: Āma āvuso, passāmi. A: Āyatiṁ bhante saṁvareyyātha. C: Sādhu suṭṭhu āvuso saṁvarissāmi

rule_pali: Bhūtārocana: Yā pana bhikkhunī anupasampannāya uttarimanussadhammaṁ āroceyya bhūtasmiṁ, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 104. Factual Claim: Should any bhikkhunī report (her own) superior human state to an unordained person, when it is factual, it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If he speaks of what is a fact to one who is ordained; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Effort: One reports one's actual attainment of a superior human state 2) Object: to an unordained person, i.e., any human being who is not a bhikkhu or bhikkhunī
formulas: S. “I, friend, having many times fallen into grave offences with different bases, these I confess J. Do you see, ven. sir? S. Yes, friend, I see J. In future, ven. sir, you should be restrained S. It is well indeed, friend. I shall be restrained

rule_pali: Duṭṭhullārocana: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā duṭṭhullaṁ āpattiṁ anupasampannāya āroceyya aññatra bhikkhunisammutiyā, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 105. Serious Offense: Should any bhikkhunī report (another) bhikkhunī's serious offense to an unordained person—unless authorized by the bhikkhunīs—it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If he speaks of the class but not of an offence; if he speaks of an offence but not of the class; if there is the agreement of the monks; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object a serious offense committed by another bhikkhu. 2) Effort: One reports it to an unordained person without having been authorized to do so by the Community
notes: To say, “Ven. Upananda committed a saṅghādisesa by masturbating,” is full offense; while to say simply, “Ven. Upananda committed a saṅghādisesa,” or “Ven. Upananda masturbated,” would not even wrong doing
formulas: For other categories of offenses, change dukkaṭāyo to thullaccayāyo, nissaggiyāyo pācittiyāyo, pācittiyāyo, or dubbhāsitāyo,

rule_pali: Pathavikhaṇana: Yā pana bhikkhunī pathaviṁ khaṇeyya vā khaṇāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 106. Digging Soil: Should any bhikkhunī dig soil or have it dug, it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If he speaks, saying: “Find this, give this, convey this, this is wanted, make this allowable”; if it was unintentional, if (he was) not thinking, if he did not know, if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1 Object. The Pali word for soil, paṭhavī, also means ground or earth. 2 Effort. The Vibhaṅga says that the term digging also covers burning, 3 Perception. If one perceives a patch of genuine soil not to be genuine soil, it is not grounds for an offense. If one is in doubt as to whether a patch of earth is classed as genuine soil, it is grounds for a dukkaṭa regardless of whether it is actually classed as genuine soil or not. 4 Intention to make a hole in the ground
notes: Kappiya-vohāra—“allowable expression,” or “wording it right” use in the context of rules where an express command would be an offense, but an indication of a desire or intent would not. This rule, together with the following one, also effectively prevents bhikkhus from engaging in agriculture

rule_pali: Bhūtagāma: Bhūtagāmapātabyatāya pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 107. Damaging Plants: The damaging of a living plant is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If he speaks, saying: “Find this, give this, convey this, this is wanted, make this allowable”; if it was unintentional, if (he was) not thinking, if he did not know; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: a bhikkhu who should not be forced to move. 2) Perception: One perceives him as such. 3) Effort: One intrudes on his space in a dwelling belonging to the Community 4) Intention: with the sole purpose of forcing him out
notes: Algae, fungus, and mold would count as filth so remove them is not offense. seedless fruit or fruit whose seeds may be removed entirely from the flesh of the fruit are allowable by themselves other fruit need “Kappiyaṁ karohi (Make it allowable).”
formulas: BU-PC12 Evasion Suṇātu me bhante saṅgho. Ayaṁ Itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjiyamāno aññenaññaṁ paṭicarati. Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho Itthannāmassa bhikkhuno aññavādakaṁ ropeyya. Esā ñatti

rule_pali: Aññavādaka: Aññavādake vihesake pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 108. Evasive Speech: Evasive speech and causing frustration are to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If, not knowing, he asks; if, being ill, he does not speak; if, thinking: ‘Quarrel or dispute or strife or contention will come to be for the Order,’ he does not speak; if, thinking: ‘There will come to be schism in the Order or dissension in the Order,’ he does not speak; if, thinking: ‘He will carry out an (official) act according to what is not the rule, or by an incomplete congregation, or against one who is not suitable for an (official) act,’ he does not speak; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Intention: One’s motive is to hide one’s offenses. 2) Effort: One continues engaging in evasive speech or in causing frustration 3) Object: when being questioned in the Community about a rule or an offense after the Community has brought a formal charge of evasive speech or causing frustration against one
notes: Sangha does formal charge of evasive speech or causing frustration. If he continues being uncooperative, he may further be subject to a more severe penalty, a censure transaction
formulas: This Bhikkhu (name), when questioned in the midst of the Community about an offense, evades one question with another. If the Community is ready, it should make public Bhikkhu (name)’s evasive speech. This is the motion

rule_pali: Ujjhāpanaka: Ujjhāpanake khiyyanake pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 109. Criticizing Officials: Criticizing or complaining (about a Community official) is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If he makes (someone) look down upon or if he criticises one acting by nature from desire, from hatred, from stupidity, from fear; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: (1) a bhikkhu who (2) has been properly authorized as a Community official and (3) does not habitually act out of the four causes for bias: desire, aversion, delusion, or fear. 2) Effort: criticizing or complaining about a Community official is a pācittiya if one’s listener is a fellow bhikkhu, and a dukkaṭa if listener is an unordained person 3) Intention: motive is to make him lose face, lose status, or feel abashed
notes: Wrong doing for criticism of unordained person, a Community official without having been authorized or having been improperly authorized,
formulas: BU-PC12 Frustrating Suṇātu me bhante saṅgho. Ayaṁ Itthannāmo bhikkhu saṅghamajjhe āpattiyā anuyuñjiyamāno tuṇhībhūto saṅghaṁ viheseti. Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho Itthannāmassa bhikkhuno vihesakaṁ ropeyya. Esā ñatti

rule_pali: Paṭhamasenāsana: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṅghikaṁ mañcaṁ vā pīṭhaṁ vā... ajjhokāse santharitvā vā... na paṭinissajjeyya... pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 110. Furniture in Open: Should any bhikkhunī set a bed, bench, mattress, or stool belonging to the Community out in the open... and leave without putting it away... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If, having removed it, he goes away; if, having caused it to be removed, he goes away; if, having asked (for permission), he goes away; if, drying himself in the sun, he goes away; if it comes to be taken possession of by something; if there are accidents; if it belongs to the individual himself, if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: any bed, bench, mattress, or stool belonging to the Community. 2) Effort: One sets such furnishings out in the open and then departs without taking leave, putting the furnishings away, or getting them put away in the proper place. 3) Intention: One has set them out for some purpose other than sunning them
notes: In dry season may also be kept in an open pavilion roofed with slats or branches, or under tree without droppings. Purpose is to prevent negligence and to teach one to care for things. It should be taken as a general model.”
formulas: BU-PC12 Frustrating Venerable sirs, may the Community listen to me. This Bhikkhu (name), when questioned in the midst of the Community about an offense, frustrates the Community by remaining silent. If the Community is ready, it should make public Bhikkhu (name)’s act of causing frustration. This is the motion

rule_pali: Dutiyasenāsana: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṅghike vihāre seyyaṁ santharitvā vā... na paṭinissajjeyya... pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 111. Bedding in Dwelling: Should any bhikkhunī set out bedding in a dwelling belonging to the Community... and leave without putting it away... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If, having removed it, he goes away; if, having caused it to be removed, he goes away; if, having asked (for permission), he goes away; if it comes to be taken possession of by something; if going with the expectation, standing there, he asks (for permission); if he becomes taken possession of by something; if there are accidents; if belong to individual himself, if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: Bedding here includes mattresses, pillows, rugs, sheets, mats, sitting cloths, blankets, bedspreads, animal skins, throw rugs, etc., 2) Effort: One sets such bedding out in the open and then departs without taking leave, putting them away, or getting them put away in the proper place. 3) Intention: One has set them out and plans to return
notes: The bedding is the responsibility of the bhikkhu with the claim on the dwelling, and not of the visitor. putting it away is back in the safe place where it was kept before being spread out

rule_pali: Anupakhajja: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṁ saṅghike vihāre pubbupagataṁ bhikkhuniṁ anupakhajja seyyaṁ kappeyya... pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 112. Intruding: Should any bhikkhunī knowingly lie down in a dwelling belonging to the Community so as to intrude on a bhikkhunī who arrived there first... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If an ill man enters, if one pressed by cold or by heat enters, if there are accidents; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer. dukkaṭa in telling someone else to evict the bhikkhu—
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: a bhikkhu who should not be forced to move. 2) Perception: One perceives him as such. 3) Effort: One intrudes on his space in a dwelling belonging to the Community 4) Intention: with the sole purpose of forcing him out
notes: Commentary defines as anywhere within 75 cm. of the sleeping or sitting place where one knows, “This bhikkhu shouldn’t be forced to move.”

rule_pali: Nikaḍḍhana: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniṁ kupitā anattamanā saṅghikā vihārā nikaḍḍheyya vā nikaḍḍhāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 113. Evicting: Should any bhikkhunī, angered and displeased, evict a bhikkhunī from a dwelling belonging to the Community... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: In evicting anyone when one’s primary impulse is not anger, belongings from one’s own dwelling or one take on trust, if evicting anyone—or the requisites of anyone—who is insane, unconscientious in his/her behavior, or a maker of quarrels, strife, and dissension in the Community. if evict one’s student or his belongings from his dwelling if he is not properly observing his duties
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: a bhikkhu. 2) Effort: One evicts him from a dwelling belonging to the Community. 3) Intention: One’s prime impulse is anger
notes: Bhikkhu is pācittiya, while dukkaṭa: a bhikkhu’s belongings, an unordained person, and an unordained person’s belongings. dukkaṭa in telling someone else to evict the bhikkhu. if one’s primary motive is greed, anger was simply a function of frustrated greed, and the two emotions would easily go together to infraction of this rule

rule_pali: Vehāsakuṭi: Yā pana bhikkhunī saṅghike vihāre vehāsakuṭiyā āhaccapādakaṁ mañcaṁ vā pīṭhaṁ vā abhinisīdeyya vā abhinipajjeyya vā, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 114. Loft Bed: Should any bhikkhunī sit or lie down on a bed or bench with detachable legs on an (unplanked) loft... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there is no one under the loft; if the area under the loft cannot be used as a dwelling, if the bed or bench with detachable legs is on the ground; or are securely fixed to their frame
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: loft is a partial second story in a dwelling; and bed or bench with detachable legs 2) Effort: sitting and lying down on it
notes: Perhaps the Buddha’s purpose in formulating this rule was to discourage detachable legs their being placed in the loft in the first place

rule_pali: Mahallakavihāra: Mahallakaṁ pana bhikkhuniyā vihāraṁ kārayamānāya... pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 115. Roofing: When a bhikkhunī is having a large dwelling built, she may supervise 2 or 3 layers of facing... should she supervise more... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If there are two or three enclosures; if there are less than two or three enclosures; if it is in a cave, if it is in a hut, if it is in a tiṇa-grass hut; if it is for another; if it is by means of his own property; anything other than a dwelling, if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
notes: Rule deals with techniques used in building dwellings 2,500 years ago, the Canon and commentaries contain terms whose meaning is uncertain at present. Aimed at preventing bhikkhus from abusing the generosity of the person sponsoring

rule_pali: Sappāṇaka: Yā pana bhikkhunī jānaṁ sappāṇakaṁ udakaṁ tiṇaṁ vā mattikaṁ vā siñceyya vā siñcāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 116. Pouring Water: Should any bhikkhunī knowingly pour water containing living beings... on grass or on clay, it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If it was unintentional, if he was not thinking, if he did not know; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: water contain living creatures 2) Perception: either knows on one’s own or has been told that the living creatures are there. 3) Effort: pouring the water or having it poured 4) Intention: aim of pouring the water or having it poured
notes: Under this rule to prevent the pouring of lethal pollutants into water. no allowance for kappiya-vohāra (“wording it right”) under this rule

rule_pali: Āvasathapiṇḍa: Agilānāya bhikkhuniyā eko āvasathapiṇḍo bhuñjitabbo. Tato ce uttari bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 117. Food Station: A bhikkhunī who is not ill may eat one meal at a public alms center. If she should eat more than that, it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If he is ill; if he eats once when he is not ill; if he eats going out or coming in; if the proprietors, having invited him, offer him food, if it is specially prepared (for him); if the center determines the amount of food the recipients may take; setting aside the five (kinds of) meals there is no offence in (eating) any others; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1 Object: public alms center is a place where all comers are offered as much food as they want, free of charge. 2 Effort: eating in the center two days running,
notes: Eating in the same center two days running, To eat one day in one center and the next day in another entails no penalty

rule_pali: Gaṇabhojana: Gaṇabhojane aññatra samayā pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 118. Group Meal: A group meal is to be confessed, except on the proper occasions.
no_offense_factors: If it is at a right time; if two or three eat together; if having walked one by one for alms, they eat having assembled together; if it is the regular supply of food; if it is food (allowed by) ticket; if it is (food given) on a day of the waxing or waning of the moon,if it is (given) on an Observance day, or the day after; setting aside the five (kinds of) meals, there is no offence in (eating) any other; if donor is from other religions; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1 Object: group meal consist of any of the five types of staple foods to which four or more bhikkhus are invited. 2 Effort: applies exclusively to invitations to specific groups—not Communities—of four or more bhikkhus regardless of whether the invitation mentions the word “food” or “meal.” 3 Intention: specify the names or groups of bhikkhus to be invited
notes: Purposes are “For the restraint of evil-minded individuals, for the comfort of well-behaved bhikkhus, so that those with evil desires will not split the Community by (forming) a faction, and out of compassion for families.”

english_name: Accepting Two or Three Bowls Full
rule_pali: Paramparabhojana: Paramparabhojane aññatra samayā pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 119. Turn-by-Turn: An out-of-turn meal is to be confessed, except on the proper occasions.
no_offense_factors: If he accepts two or three bowlfuls or less; if they give what is prepared neither as a present nor as provisions for a journey; if they give the remainder of what is prepared either as a present or as provisions for a journey; if they give because the journey is given up; if they belong to relations; if they are invited; if they are for the good of another; if it is by means of his own property; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Effort: Receiving more than three bowlfuls 2) Object: of cakes or cooked grain-meal (sattu), use as presents or as provisions for a journey
notes: The purpose of this rule is to prevent bhikkhus from abusing a donor’s generosity and good faith

rule_pali: Kāṇamātā: Yā pana bhikkhunī... dvattipattapūre paṭiggahetabbaṁ... pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 120. Biscuits: Should a bhikkhunī... accept more than two or three bowlfuls of cakes/barley meal... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: Offense if, having a reason, one consumes juice drinks, any of the five tonics, medicine, or water after noon or before dawnrise; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: staple or non-staple food that is not leftover. 2) Effort: chew or consume staple or non-staple food at the wrong time
notes: No exception is granted to an ill bhikkhu, because there are a number of edibles an ill bhikkhu may consume at the wrong time without involving an offense: juice drinks, the five tonics, and medicines

rule_pali: Pavārita: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhuṭṭhāvī pavāritā anatirittaṁ khādanīyaṁ vā bhojanīyaṁ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 121. One Meal: Should any bhikkhunī, having eaten and turned down an offer... eat (other) staple or non-staple food... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If , having stored (food) for the time being, he eats it in that time; if, having stored (food to be eaten) during a watch of the night, he eats it in a watch of the night; if, having stored (food) to be eaten during seven days, he eats it in seven days; if, when there is a reason, he uses (food to be eaten) during life; if he is mad; if he is the first wrong-doer, in the mere act of storing food
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: staple or non-staple food that is not leftover. Stored-up means formally accepted by a bhikkhu on one day and eaten on the next or a later day. 2) Effort: chew or consume staple or non-staple food at the wrong time
notes: Monasteries leftovers from the bhikkhus‘ meals may not be served to the bhikkhus again on a later day. Large portions can be offered separately day by day. no offense in telling an unordained person to store food that has not been formally received

rule_pali: Viggahā: Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniṁ bhuṭṭhāviṁ pavāritaṁ... anatirittena khādanīyena vā bhojanīyena vā abhihaṭṭhuṁ pavāreyya... pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 122. Tempting: Should any bhikkhunī, knowing that a bhikkhunī has eaten... invite her to eat... (to charge her with an offense), it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: In regard to water for cleansing the teeth; if himself, having taken the four foul things, he makes use of them when there is a reason (and if) there is no one to make them allowable; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1 Object: edible is whatever is fit to eat, that has not been given. 2 Effort: dukkaṭa if, with the intention of eating it, he takes food that hasn’t been properly given; and a pācittiya for every mouthful he eats
notes: Allowance in Cv 5 26 states that if food accidentally falls while being offered, a bhikkhu may pick it up himself and eat it without committing an offense
useful_texts: Cv 5 26 allowance, fallen fruit Mv 6 17.8-9; Mv 6 32

english_name: Sending a Bhikkhu Back from Almsround
rule_pali: Vikālabhojana: Yā pana bhikkhunī vikāle khādanīyaṁ vā bhojanīyaṁ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 123. Wrong Time: Should any bhikkhunī eat staple or non-staple food at the wrong time (after noon), it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If dismissing one’s companion with the thought that two bhikkhus going together won’t obtain enough food; dismissing him after seeing costly goods ahead, so that he won’t develop a feeling of greed; dismissing him after seeing a beautiful woman ahead, so that he won’t lose his resolve for the celibate life; sending him back with food for one who is sick, who was left behind, or who is guarding the monastery; or dismissing him for any other proper reason as long as one is not planning to indulge in misconduct; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: another bhikkhu. 2) Intention: One wants to indulge in misconduct and does not want him to see it. 3) Effort: One dismisses him. 4) Result: He leaves one’s range of hearing and sight
notes: The factors for this offense apply in any location and at any time of the day
formulas: This pattern—three pācittiyas and three dukkaṭas—is repeated in all the rules where a bhikkhu is grounds for a pācittiya, an unordained person is grounds for a dukkaṭa, and perception is not a mitigating factor

english_name: Intruding on a Couple Enjoying Themselves
rule_pali: Sannidhikāraka: Yā pana bhikkhunī sannidhikārakaṁ khādanīyaṁ vā bhojanīyaṁ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 124. Stored Food: Should any bhikkhunī eat staple or non-staple food that has been stored, it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If both the man and woman have left the bedroom/private area; if neither of them is sexually aroused; if the building is not a “sleeping building”; if the bhikkhu is not in the private area; if he has a companion.; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1 Object: a couple together in their private quarters, with at least one of them desiring sexual intercourse with the other. 2 Effort: to sit—without another bhikkhu present—in the private area of the house,
notes: A bhikkhu should not sit intruding on a couple unless they both make him 100% certain that he is welcome

rule_pali: Paṇītabhojana: Yā pana bhikkhunī... paṇītabhojanāni attanā viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 125. Fine Foods: Should any bhikkhunī... ask for fine foods (ghee, butter, oil, honey, molasses, fish, meat, milk, curds) for her own sake... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If some learned friend comes to be (present); if he stands, does not sit; if he is not desirous of a private place; if he sits down thinking about something else; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Effort: One sits with her alone—without another person present—in a place private to the ear and to the eye, and secluded. 2) Object: woman is defined as female human being who knows what is properly an what is lewd. Paṇḍakas, female petas, female yakkhas, and animals in the form of a woman are grounds for a dukkaṭa. 3) Intention: One must be aiming at privacy for this factor to be fulfilled
notes: Woman here includes women as well. In other words, even if one is sitting with many women in the secluded area. even when his motives are pure, he is inviting the suspicions of others. the woman, may make any claims she likes about what went on while they were alone together

rule_pali: Dantapona: Yā pana bhikkhunī adinnaṁ mukhadvāraṁ āhāraṁ āhareyya aññatra udakadantaponā, pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 126. Unoffered Food: Should any bhikkhunī put into her mouth edible food that has not been given... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If some learned friend comes to be (present); if he stands, does not sit; if he is not desirous of a private place; if he sits down thinking about something else; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Effort: One sits with her alone—without another person present—in a place private to the ear and to the eye, but not secluded. 2) Object: woman is defined as female human being who knows what is properly an what is lewd. Paṇḍakas, female petas, female yakkhas, and animals in the form of a woman are grounds for a dukkaṭa. 3) Intention: One must be aiming at privacy for this factor to be fulfilled
notes: If it would be convenient for committing sexual intercourse, it would fall under the preceding rule; if not, it would fall here. In this rule the other person whose presence exempts one from this factor can be either a man or a woman

rule_pali: Mahānāma: Agilānāya bhikkhuniyā catumāsappaccayapavāraṇā sāditabbā... pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 127. Invitation Limit: A bhikkhunī... may accept an invitation for at most 4 months. If she accepts for longer... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If at the right time, he enters having asked (for permission) if a monk be there; if he enters not having asked (for permission) if a monk be not there; if the way is through the house of another; or the precincts of a house; if he is going into a village; if he is going to the nuns’ quarters; if he is going to a sleeping-place of adherents of other sects; if he is returning from these places; if he is going to a house for food; if there are accidents; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: a family residence. 2) Effort: One enters such a residence—without having taken leave of an available bhikkhu—on a morning when one has been invited to a meal, except during the time exemptions mentioned in the rule
notes: The purpose is to prevent bhikkhus from taking the invitation as an excuse to visit lay people and spend their time in inappropriate activities. if one is without dependance (nissya) taking leave in the context of this rule means the simple act of informing the other bhikkhu not asking for permission

rule_pali: Uyyuttasenā: Yā pana bhikkhunī uyyuttaṁ senaṁ dassanāya gaccheyya... pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 128. Seeing Army: Should any bhikkhunī go to see an army on active duty... it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If he asks for those medicines which he came to be invited (to accept); if he asks for those nights for which he came to be invited (to accept); if he asks, explaining, ‘Of those medicines which we were invited by you (to accept) we need this and that medicine’; if he asks, explaining, ‘Those nights for which we were invited by you have passed and we need medicine’; if they belong to relations; if they are invited; if it is for the sake of another; if it is by means of his own property; if he is mad, if he is the first wrong-doer
offense_factors_bmc: 1) Object: medicine that a donor has invited a Community to request. 2) Effort: One requests it outside of the terms of the invitation when one is not ill
notes: Person making the invitation was expected to provide the goods he offered, while bhikkhus were expected to be reasonable in their requests. Normally, an ill bhikkhu may ask anyone for medicine at any time,

rule_pali: Senāvāsa: Siyā ca tassā bhikkhuniyā kocideva paccayo senaṁ gamanāya... dirattatirattaṁ senāya vasitabbaṁ... pācittiyaṁ.
rule_english: 129. Army Stay: Should a bhikkhunī... stay with an army for more than two or three consecutive nights, it is to be confessed.
no_offense_factors: If, having gone on business, one sees the army; if, standing within a monastery, one watches an army fighting or holding practice maneuvers nearby; if an army comes to where one happens to be; if one meets an army coming from the opposite direction; or if there are dangers
offense_factors_bmc: 1 Object: army in active duty 2 Effort: fulfilled simply by staying still and watching an army on duty except when one has a suitable reason. 3 Intention: Suitable reason might be to visit a relative in the army that is ill
notes: Armies not on active duty, as when they organize charity events, would not be grounds for an offense

rule_pali: Uyyodhika: Yā pana bhikkhunī... uyyodhikaṁ vā... dassanāya gaccheyya, pācittiyaṁ.
